title: Green Maghrebi Lentil & Bread Stew
description: Deep, earthy, and comforting stew with lentils, toasted bread, and a fresh herby finish.
instructions: Toast: Bake bread cubes at 400F until bone dry and golden (15-20m).
Sweat: Sauté onion in olive oil until soft (5-8m). Add garlic for 1m.
Deepen: Add tomato paste & spices. Fry until paste darkens (2-3m).
Simmer: Add lentils, water/broth, crushed tomatoes, and fig spread. NO SALT YET. Simmer covered until lentils are tender (25-30m).
Finish: Stir in salt, lemon juice, and greens until wilted.
Stew: Turn off heat. Fold in toasted bread. Let sit 10m.
Serve: Top with sour cream and fresh dill.

title: Slow-Cooked Beef Brisket
description: Tender braised brisket with a rich umami glaze. Make-ahead friendly.
ingredients: 4-5 lb Beef Brisket (pat dry, heavily salted & peppered)
instructions: Sear: Heat oil in large Dutch oven. Sear brisket hard on both sides until dark brown (5-8m per side). Remove meat.
Deglaze/Sauté: Add onions to the beef fat. Cook until browning edges (5m).
Build Sauce: Stir in broth, ketchup, and fig spread. Scrape up browned bits (fond).
Assemble: Return brisket to pot (fat cap up). Surround with carrots, garlic, and herbs.
Braise: Cover tightly. Bake at 300F for 4-5 hours until fork-tender.
STOP (Make Ahead): Let cool in the liquid. Refrigerate the entire pot (or meat and liquid separately) overnight.
Slice: Remove cold brisket from liquid. Slice against the grain while cold for perfect, clean slices.
Reheat: Place slices back in the sauce. Reheat in a 325F oven for 30-45 mins until hot and the sauce is bubbly.

title: Cucumber & Dill Salad
description: A simple, crisp side dish to cut through the richness of the brisket and latkes.
ingredients: 2 English Cucumbers (or 4-5 Persian), thinly sliced rounds
1/2 Red Onion, very thinly sliced half-moons
1/4 cup Vinegar (Apple Cider or Red Wine)
instructions: The Dressing: In a large bowl, whisk together the vinegar, sugar, salt, and pepper until the sugar and salt are mostly dissolved.
The Toss: Add the sliced cucumbers, red onion, and chopped dill. Toss well to coat everything.
The Marinate: Let the salad sit in the fridge for at least 30 minutes (up to 2 hours) before serving.
Serve: Give it one last toss before serving. Use a slotted spoon if too much liquid has accumulated.
